feed.title: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository on GitHub

entry.title: [org.alluxio:alluxio-core-common] Command injection in Alluxio
entry.content:
In Alluxio before 2.7.3, the logserver does not validate the input stream. NOTE: this is not the same as the CVE-2021-44228 Log4j vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-23848
  • https://www.alluxio.io/download/releases/alluxio-2-7-3-release/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j3ch-vjph-8q6v

entry.title: [net.mingsoft:ms-mcms] SQL injection in MCMS
entry.content:
A problem was found in ming-soft MCMS v5.1. There is a sql injection vulnerability in /ms/cms/content/list.do

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44868
  • https://github.com/ming-soft/MCMS/issues/58
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2pmw-cvc7-frvh

entry.title: [net.mingsoft:ms-mcms] File upload leading to RCE in MCMS
entry.content:
An arbitrary file upload vulnerability in the component /ms/file/uploadTemplate.do of MCMS v5.2.4 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-46036
  • https://lycshub.github.io/2021/12/28/MCMS-vulnerabilities/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g8j8-mgh9-q77p

entry.title: [by.dev.madhead.doktor:doktor] Protection Mechanism Failure in Jenkins Doktor Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins Doktor Plugin 0.4.1 and earlier implements functionality that allows agent processes to render files on the controller as Markdown or Asciidoc, and error messages allow attackers able to control agent processes to determine whether a file with a given name exists.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-25204
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-02-15/#SECURITY-2548
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-64q9-f38h-9mwx

entry.title: [net.mingsoft:ms-mcms] Path traversal in MCMS
entry.content:
MCMS v5.2.4 was discovered to contain an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability via the component /template/unzip.do.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-46037
  • https://lycshub.github.io/2021/12/28/MCMS-vulnerabilities/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-73wx-rpj3-mx46

entry.title: [net.mingsoft:ms-mcms] Path traversal in MCMS
entry.content:
MCMS v5.2.5 was discovered to contain an arbitrary file deletion vulnerability via the component oldFileName.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-46062
  • https://github.com/ming-soft/MCMS/issues/59
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rpvr-mw7r-25xx

entry.title: [net.mingsoft:ms-mcms] Server Side Template Injection in MCMS
entry.content:
MCMS v5.2.5 was discovered to contain a Server Side Template Injection (SSTI) vulnerability via the Template Management module.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-46063
  • https://github.com/ming-soft/MCMS/issues/59
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gc79-gh4f-9g6w

entry.title: [org.apache.jspwiki:jspwiki-main] Cross-site Scripting in Apache JSPWiki
entry.content:
A carefully crafted user preferences for submission could trigger an XSS vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki, related to the user preferences screen, which could allow the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.2 or later.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24948
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/86p0yzopc4mw2h5bkwpt927b2c8tfq3b
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/02/25/2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9953-fmrw-v4vm

entry.title: [org.apache.jspwiki:jspwiki-main] Cross Site Request Forgery in Apache JSPWiki
entry.content:
Apache JSPWiki user preferences form is vulnerable to CSRF attacks, which can lead to account takeover. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.2 or later.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24947
  • https://lists.apache.org/thread/txrgykjkpt80t57kzpbjo8kfrv8ss02c
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/02/25/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4284-x26r-4hhc

entry.title: [com.wire:avs] Use of Externally-Controlled Format String in wire-avs
entry.content:
Impact

A remote format string vulnerability allowed an attacker to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Patches

  • The issue has been fixed in wire-avs 7.1.12 and is already included on all Wire products (currently used version is 8.0.x)

Workarounds

  • No workaround known

References

  • Fixed in commit https://github.com/wireapp/wire-avs/commit/40d373ede795443ae6f2f756e9fb1f4f4ae90bbe

For more information

If you have any questions or comments about this advisory feel free to email us at vulnerability-report@wire.com

References

  • https://github.com/wireapp/wire-avs/security/advisories/GHSA-2j6v-xpf3-xvrv
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2j6v-xpf3-xvrv

entry.title: [net.lingala.zip4j:zip4j] Uncaught Exception in zip4j
entry.content:
zip4j up to 2.9.0 can throw various uncaught exceptions while parsing a specially crafted ZIP file, which could result in an application crash. This could be used to mount a denial of service attack against services that use zip4j library.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-24615
  • https://github.com/srikanth-lingala/zip4j/issues/377
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q62h-jw38-24vh

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins.workflow:workflow-multibranch] Link Following in Jenkins Pipeline Multibranch Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins Pipeline: Multibranch Plugin 706.vd43c65dec013 and earlier follows symbolic links to locations outside of the checkout directory for the configured SCM when reading files using the readTrusted step, allowing attackers able to configure Pipelines permission to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-25179
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-02-15/#SECURITY-2613
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2m9w-9xh2-wxc3

entry.title: [edu.stanford.nlp:stanford-corenlp] Access Control vulnerability within CoreNLP
entry.content:
An Incorrect Access Control vulnerability exists in CoreNLP 4.3.2 via the classifier in NERServlet.java (lines 158 and 159).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44550
  • https://github.com/stanfordnlp/CoreNLP/issues/1222
  • https://github.com/stanfordnlp/CoreNLP/commit/5ee097dbede547023e88f60ed3f430ff09398b87
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x2p8-rgfm-qw3v

entry.title: [org.jeecgframework.boot:jeecg-boot-base-core] SQL Injection in Jeecg-boot
entry.content:
Jeecg-boot v3.0 was discovered to contain a SQL injection vulnerability via the code parameter in /jeecg-boot/sys/user/queryUserByDepId.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-22880
  • https://github.com/jeecgboot/jeecg-boot/issues/3347
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vh2r-x97c-2vpr

entry.title: [org.jeecgframework.boot:jeecg-boot-base] SQL Injection in Jeecg-boot
entry.content:
Jeecg-boot v3.0 was discovered to contain a SQL injection vulnerability via the code parameter in /jeecg-boot/sys/user/queryUserByDepId.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-22880
  • https://github.com/jeecgboot/jeecg-boot/issues/3347
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vh2r-x97c-2vpr

entry.title: [org.jeecgframework.boot:jeecg-boot-base-core] SQL Injection in Jeecg-boot
entry.content:
Jeecg-boot v3.0 was discovered to contain a SQL injection vulnerability via the code parameter in /sys/user/queryUserComponentData.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-22881
  • https://github.com/jeecgboot/jeecg-boot/issues/3348
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f9pg-g9xw-r5g2

entry.title: [org.jeecgframework.boot:jeecg-boot-base] SQL Injection in Jeecg-boot
entry.content:
Jeecg-boot v3.0 was discovered to contain a SQL injection vulnerability via the code parameter in /sys/user/queryUserComponentData.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-22881
  • https://github.com/jeecgboot/jeecg-boot/issues/3348
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-f9pg-g9xw-r5g2

entry.title: [com.convertigo.jenkins.plugins:convertigo-mobile-platform] Improper Synchronization in Jenkins Convertigo Mobile Platform Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins Convertigo Mobile Platform Plugin 1.1 and earlier uses static fields to store job configuration information, allowing attackers with Item/Configure permission to capture passwords of the jobs that will be configured.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-25210
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-02-15/#SECURITY-2280
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vwx4-frpr-w27j

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:dbCharts] Missing Authorization in Jenkins dbCharts Plugin
entry.content:
A missing check in Jenkins dbCharts Plugin 0.5.2 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to connect to an attacker-specified database via JDBC using attacker-specified credentials.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-25206
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-02-15/#SECURITY-2177
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m5wp-p3gj-7q5g

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:dbCharts] Cross-Site Request Forgery in Jenkins dbCharts Plugin
entry.content:
A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins dbCharts Plugin 0.5.2 and earlier allows attackers to connect to an attacker-specified database via JDBC using attacker-specified credentials and to determine if a class is available in the Jenkins instance.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-25205
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2022-02-15/#SECURITY-2177
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vx6f-6rp6-f2px
